channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Colour and Brush Stroke Pattern Recognition in Abstract Art using Modified Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: Further this paper explores the generated latent space by performing random walks to understand vector relationships between brush strokes and colours in the abstract art space and a statistical analysis of unstable outputs after a certain period of GAN training and compare its significant difference.

item.title: Efficient Algorithms for Regularized Nonnegative Scale-invariant Low-rank Approximation Models
item.description: However, from a practical perspective, the choice of regularizers and regularization coefficients, as well as the design of efficient algorithms, is challenging because of the multifactor nature of these models and the lack of theory to back these choices.

item.title: CoBOS: Constraint-Based Online Scheduler for Human-Robot Collaboration
item.description: The user will experience less stress as the robotic coworkers adapt their behavior to best complement the human-selected activities to complete the common task.

item.title: Physics-Informed Graph Neural Networks for Water Distribution Systems
item.description: In this realm, we propose a novel and efficient machine learning emulator, more precisely, a physics-informed deep learning (DL) model, for hydraulic state estimation in WDS.

item.title: Can Language Beat Numerical Regression? Language-Based Multimodal Trajectory Prediction
item.description: Next, to guide the language model in understanding and reasoning high-level knowledge, such as scene context and social relationships between pedestrians, we introduce an auxiliary multi-task question and answering.

item.title: Ship in Sight: Diffusion Models for Ship-Image Super Resolution
item.description: In this context, our method explores in depth the problem of ship image super resolution, which is crucial for coastal and port surveillance.

item.title: On Optimizing Hyperparameters for Quantum Neural Networks
item.description: The increasing capabilities of Machine Learning (ML) models go hand in hand with an immense amount of data and computational power required for training.

item.title: From Two-Dimensional to Three-Dimensional Environment with Q-Learning: Modeling Autonomous Navigation with Reinforcement Learning and no Libraries
item.description: This study explores the performance of RL agents in both two-dimensional (2D) and three-dimensional (3D) environments, aiming to research the dynamics of learning across different spatial dimensions.

item.title: Generative Medical Segmentation
item.description: Concretely, GMS employs a robust pre-trained Variational Autoencoder (VAE) to derive latent representations of both images and masks, followed by a mapping model that learns the transition from image to mask in the latent space.

item.title: Unleashing the Potential of SAM for Medical Adaptation via Hierarchical Decoding
item.description: This paper introduces H-SAM: a prompt-free adaptation of SAM tailored for efficient fine-tuning of medical images via a two-stage hierarchical decoding procedure.

item.title: skscope: Fast Sparsity-Constrained Optimization in Python
item.description: Applying iterative solvers on sparsity-constrained optimization (SCO) requires tedious mathematical deduction and careful programming/debugging that hinders these solvers' broad impact.

item.title: Theoretical Bound-Guided Hierarchical VAE for Neural Image Codecs
item.description: Recent studies reveal a significant theoretical link between variational autoencoders (VAEs) and rate-distortion theory, notably in utilizing VAEs to estimate the theoretical upper bound of the information rate-distortion function of images.

item.title: NL-ITI: Optimizing Probing and Intervention for Improvement of ITI Method
item.description: Large Language Models (LLM) are prone to returning false information.

item.title: Object Pose Estimation via the Aggregation of Diffusion Features
item.description: To achieve this, we propose three distinct architectures that can effectively capture and aggregate diffusion features of different granularity, greatly improving the generalizability of object pose estimation.

item.title: An Image Grid Can Be Worth a Video: Zero-shot Video Question Answering Using a VLM
item.description: Recently, an alternative strategy has surfaced, employing readily available foundation models, such as VideoLMs and LLMs, across multiple stages for modality bridging.

item.title: CYCLE: Learning to Self-Refine the Code Generation
item.description: Pre-trained code language models have achieved promising performance in code generation and improved the programming efficiency of human developers.

item.title: SingularTrajectory: Universal Trajectory Predictor Using Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we propose SingularTrajectory, a diffusion-based universal trajectory prediction framework to reduce the performance gap across the five tasks.

item.title: BlendX: Complex Multi-Intent Detection with Blended Patterns
item.description: Task-oriented dialogue (TOD) systems are commonly designed with the presumption that each utterance represents a single intent.

item.title: Identification and Uses of Deep Learning Backbones via Pattern Mining
item.description: Here we explore the notion of identifying a backbone of deep learning for a given group of instances.

item.title: Fact Checking Beyond Training Set
item.description: We then focus on the reader component and propose to train it such that it is insensitive towards the order of claims and evidence documents.

item.title: Large Language Models Need Consultants for Reasoning: Becoming an Expert in a Complex Human System Through Behavior Simulation
item.description: In the MEOW framework, simulated data are utilized to train an expert model concentrating ``experience'' about a specific task in each independent time of simulation.

item.title: Generative Multi-modal Models are Good Class-Incremental Learners
item.description: In class-incremental learning (CIL) scenarios, the phenomenon of catastrophic forgetting caused by the classifier's bias towards the current task has long posed a significant challenge.

item.title: ECoDepth: Effective Conditioning of Diffusion Models for Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: We argue that the embedding vector from a ViT model, pre-trained on a large dataset, captures greater relevant information for SIDE than the usual route of generating pseudo image captions, followed by CLIP based text embeddings.

item.title: ParCo: Part-Coordinating Text-to-Motion Synthesis
item.description: However, these methods encounter challenges such as the lack of coordination between different part motions and difficulties for networks to understand part concepts.

item.title: Minimax Optimal Fair Classification with Bounded Demographic Disparity
item.description: Mitigating the disparate impact of statistical machine learning methods is crucial for ensuring fairness.

item.title: DSF-GAN: DownStream Feedback Generative Adversarial Network
item.description: Thus, DSF-GAN utilizes a downstream prediction task to enhance the utility of synthetic samples.

item.title: DiffusionFace: Towards a Comprehensive Dataset for Diffusion-Based Face Forgery Analysis
item.description: The rapid progress in deep learning has given rise to hyper-realistic facial forgery methods, leading to concerns related to misinformation and security risks.

item.title: Tensor-based Graph Learning with Consistency and Specificity for Multi-view Clustering
item.description: By making an assumption that the learned neighbor graph of each view comprises both a consistent graph and a view-specific graph, we formulate a new tensor-based target graph learning paradigm.

item.title: Improved Neural Protoform Reconstruction via Reflex Prediction
item.description: Protolanguage reconstruction is central to historical linguistics.

item.title: Beyond Embeddings: The Promise of Visual Table in Multi-Modal Models
item.description: When visual tables serve as standalone visual representations, our model can closely match or even beat the SOTA MLLMs that are built on CLIP visual embeddings.

item.title: ImageNet-D: Benchmarking Neural Network Robustness on Diffusion Synthetic Object
item.description: In this work, we introduce generative model as a data source for synthesizing hard images that benchmark deep models' robustness.

item.title: ModaLink: Unifying Modalities for Efficient Image-to-PointCloud Place Recognition
item.description: Experimental results on the KITTI dataset show that our proposed methods achieve state-of-the-art performance while running in real time.

item.title: Attention Calibration for Disentangled Text-to-Image Personalization
item.description: However, an intriguing problem persists: Is it possible to capture multiple, novel concepts from one single reference image?

item.title: Benchmarking Object Detectors with COCO: A New Path Forward
item.description: With these findings, we advocate using COCO-ReM for future object detection research.

item.title: Supervised Multiple Kernel Learning approaches for multi-omics data integration
item.description: Advances in high-throughput technologies have originated an ever-increasing availability of omics datasets.

item.title: A Semi-supervised Nighttime Dehazing Baseline with Spatial-Frequency Aware and Realistic Brightness Constraint
item.description: There are two distinctions between nighttime and daytime haze.

item.title: Many-Objective Evolutionary Influence Maximization: Balancing Spread, Budget, Fairness, and Time
item.description: The Influence Maximization (IM) problem seeks to discover the set of nodes in a graph that can spread the information propagation at most.

item.title: Efficient Heatmap-Guided 6-Dof Grasp Detection in Cluttered Scenes
item.description: Specifically, Gaussian encoding and the grid-based strategy are applied to predict grasp heatmaps as guidance to aggregate local points into graspable regions and provide global semantic information.

item.title: Faster Convergence for Transformer Fine-tuning with Line Search Methods
item.description: Recent works have shown that line search methods greatly increase performance of traditional stochastic gradient descent methods on a variety of datasets and architectures [1], [2].

item.title: On Spectrogram Analysis in a Multiple Classifier Fusion Framework for Power Grid Classification Using Electric Network Frequency
item.description: The Electric Network Frequency (ENF) serves as a unique signature inherent to power distribution systems.

item.title: SemRoDe: Macro Adversarial Training to Learn Representations That are Robust to Word-Level Attacks
item.description: Language models (LMs) are indispensable tools for natural language processing tasks, but their vulnerability to adversarial attacks remains a concern.

item.title: Clustering Change Sign Detection by Fusing Mixture Complexity
item.description: In this paper, we propose MC fusion as an extension of MC to handle situations in which multiple mixture numbers are possible in a finite mixture model.

item.title: Sequential Recommendation with Latent Relations based on Large Language Model
item.description: Different from previous relation-aware models that rely on predefined rules, we propose to leverage the Large Language Model (LLM) to provide new types of relations and connections between items.

item.title: HandBooster: Boosting 3D Hand-Mesh Reconstruction by Conditional Synthesis and Sampling of Hand-Object Interactions
item.description: Reconstructing 3D hand mesh robustly from a single image is very challenging, due to the lack of diversity in existing real-world datasets.

item.title: Mini-Gemini: Mining the Potential of Multi-modality Vision Language Models
item.description: We try to narrow the gap by mining the potential of VLMs for better performance and any-to-any workflow from three aspects, i. e., high-resolution visual tokens, high-quality data, and VLM-guided generation.

item.title: TriviaHG: A Dataset for Automatic Hint Generation from Factoid Questions
item.description: To evaluate the TriviaHG dataset and the proposed evaluation method, we enlisted 10 individuals to annotate 2, 791 hints and tasked 6 humans with answering questions using the provided hints.

item.title: Homogeneous Tokenizer Matters: Homogeneous Visual Tokenizer for Remote Sensing Image Understanding
item.description: Compared to Patch Embed, which requires more than one hundred tokens for one image, HOOK requires only 6 and 8 tokens for sparse and dense tasks, respectively, resulting in efficiency improvements of 1. 5 to 2. 8 times.

item.title: Long-form factuality in large language models
item.description: Empirically, we demonstrate that LLM agents can achieve superhuman rating performance - on a set of ~16k individual facts, SAFE agrees with crowdsourced human annotators 72% of the time, and on a random subset of 100 disagreement cases, SAFE wins 76% of the time.

item.title: The Impact of Uniform Inputs on Activation Sparsity and Energy-Latency Attacks in Computer Vision
item.description: We empirically examine our findings in a comprehensive evaluation with multiple image classification models and show that our attack achieves the same sparsity effect as prior sponge-example methods, but at a fraction of computation effort.

item.title: H2ASeg: Hierarchical Adaptive Interaction and Weighting Network for Tumor Segmentation in PET/CT Images
item.description: However, modality-specific encoders used in these methods operate independently, inadequately leveraging the synergistic relationships inherent in PET and CT modalities, for example, the complementarity between semantics and structure.
